title: So i have a question a slightly important one (need a rioter or anyones help)
body: So my computer can barely run low specs mode as it is on league, and i was wondering if there was a way to possibly transfer everything league of legends from my computer to my 3 terrabyte external hard drive rather then just uninstalling it and reinstalling it on there. Please help, i want to be able to keep playing this game.

replies.body:
You *could* transfer the files via usb, but there's honestly a lot that can go wrong that way. Files might not get moved correctly, or somehow get damaged in the process causing the game to go screwy. Not to mention League is built to run most efficiently from the C drive. 

You can always try transferring the files to the external, but keep in mind you might run into some issues and could possibly need to repair. In that event, I'd suggest using the [**Hextech Repair Tool**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool) for any repairs!

In that event, I'd suggest using the [**Hextech Repair Tool**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool) for any repairs!

That is an understandable reason to not move the files to the external, due to the chance that something can or will go wrong. Though if i do go though this i have to ask, do i move the folders that is in the *C: drive* first? Or move the files within the Roaming portion of my computer? Seeing as most of my issues originate with the client, since it's well really *really* slow on my computer, even if i am in low specs. Since all i really want is for the client to run faster so that way i don't dodge so many games when the client decides to lag out on me.

Thanks for your answer and recommendation to use the Hextech Repair tool Broporo! Awesome name by the way

C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\ is the folder you're going to want to concentrate on if you take that route. I don't believe you'll need to move the roaming portion, but I'm actually not entirely sure xD!

Soo i tried the transfer, it didn't work out as planned unfortunately, client kept crashing, i used the Hextech repair tool, but it didn't seem to work when i tried to do the reinstall option. So i figured it'd would pass, sadly it didn't and crashed in a game and wouldn't give me the reconnect screen. So i am transferring it back over to my computer once more. I have no idea why the client constantly kept crashing at all.

Aw heck. Worth a try eh? You could still try repairing the client on the external by running the Repair Tool with **reinstall and clean uninstall** if you didn't already! Also if you're very adamant, you can go ahead and reach out to our tech team in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) for a little more in-depth troubleshooting!

Yeah it was worth a try, yet i didn't expect to run into so many issues with it constantly crashing, no idea why it kept crashing since the connection between the port and the 3 terrabyte hard drive itself was secure. It did have to download a few extra files, but other then that, sadly the speed of the client was still the same. I did try the reinstall and clean uninstall, but nothing happened weirdly enough, despite the fact i told it where the league of legends exe was.
